The 1970s saw Sutherland continue to thrive in his career, starring in films like "Don't Look Now" (1973), "The Day of the Locust" (1975), and "Klute" (1971), which earned him an Academy Award nomination for Best Supporting Actor.

Throughout his career, Sutherland has appeared in over 150 films and television shows, including notable roles in "Invasion of the Body Snatchers" (1978), "Ordinary People" (1980), "Eye of the Needle" (1981), and "JFK" (1991). He has also worked extensively in television, starring in shows like "Sneakers" (1992), "Path to War" (2002), and "Trust" (2018).

Sutherland has received numerous awards and nominations for his performances, including an Academy Award nomination, a Golden Globe Award, and multiple Genie Awards. He was appointed an Officer of the Order of Canada in 1982 and received the Governor General's Performing Arts Award for Lifetime Achievement in 1995.

In addition to his acting career, Sutherland is known for his advocacy work on various social and environmental issues. He has been married to French actress Francoise-Yvonne Yasbeck since 1966, and they have three children together.
